sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover.description: The NavigationPopover control is used to present information in a specific format. Note: This control is used by the {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopoverHandler NavigationPopoverHandler} and must not be used manually.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new navpopover/NavigationPopover. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectName semanticObjectName} : string
    • {@link #getSemanticAttributes semanticAttributes} : object
    • {@link #getAppStateKey appStateKey} : string
    • {@link #getMainNavigationId mainNavigationId} : string
    • {@link #getAvailableActionsPersonalizationText availableActionsPersonalizationText} : string (default: undefined)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAvailableActions availableActions} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[]
    • {@link #getMainNavigation mainNavigation} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData
    • {@link #getOwnNavigation ownNavigation} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSource source} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getExtraContent extraContent} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getComponent component} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Element)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:targetsObtained targetsObtained} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:availableActionsPersonalizationPress availableActionsPersonalizationPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ResponsivePopover#constructor sap.m.ResponsivePopover} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.121 SmartLink no longer opens a NavigationPopover, it got replaced by the sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel in a sap.m.ResponsivePopover

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.description:
The SmartMicroChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings.
The entitySet property is required. This property is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the specified default OData model. Depending on the UI/ChartType annotation, the control creates a corresponding {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMicroChart SmartAreaMicroChart}, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletMicroChart SmartBulletMicroChart}, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartStackedBarMicroChart SmartStackedBarMicroChart}, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartLineMicroChart SmartLineMicroChart}, or {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialMicroChart SmartRadialMicroChart} instance and delegates it to the internal control.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.m.Size (default: "Auto")
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getChartDescription chartDescription} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getUnitOfMeasure unitOfMeasure} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getFreeText freeText} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialize initialize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.helpDescription:
The SmartMicroChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings.
The entitySet property is required. This property is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the specified default OData model. Depending on the UI/ChartType annotation, the control creates a corresponding {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMicroChart SmartAreaMicroChart}, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletMicroChart SmartBulletMicroChart}, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartStackedBarMicroChart SmartStackedBarMicroChart}, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartLineMicroChart SmartLineMicroChart}, or {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialMicroChart SmartRadialMicroChart} instance and delegates it to the internal control.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm.description: The SmartForm control renders a form (sap.ui.layout.form.Form). When used with the SmartField control the label is taken from the metadata annotation sap:label if not specified directly. Warning: Do not put any layout or other container controls into the GroupElement. Views are also not supported. This could damage the visual layout, keyboard support and screen-reader support.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartform/SmartForm. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getUseHorizontalLayout useHorizontalLayout} : boolean
    • {@link #getHorizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth} : int
    • {@link #getCheckButton checkButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEntityType entityType} : string
    • {@link #getExpandable expandable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean
    • {@link #getEditTogglable editTogglable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getFlexEnabled flexEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getValidationMode validationMode} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartFormValidationMode (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getImportance importance} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.Importance (default: Low)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGroups groups} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.Group[] (default)
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartFormLayout
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
    • {@link #getCustomToolbar customToolbar} : sap.m.Toolbar
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:editToggled editToggled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:checked checked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm.helpDescription: The SmartForm control renders a form (sap.ui.layout.form.Form). When used with the SmartField control the label is taken from the metadata annotation sap:label if not specified directly. Warning: Do not put any layout or other container controls into the GroupElement. Views are also not supported. This could damage the visual layout, keyboard support and screen-reader support.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

customToolbar.description: An additional toolbar that can be added by the users, which can contain further custom buttons, controls, etc. Note: If a special title is required inside the Toolbar, it must be added as content to the Toolbar. In this case add the Title to the ariaLabelledBy association. Use the required title level to meet the visual requirements. This might be theme-dependent.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

entityType.description:
CSV of entity types for which the flexibility features are available.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.
entityType.helpDescription:
CSV of entity types for which the flexibility features are available.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

editable.description: Applies a device-specific and theme-specific line height and label alignment to the form rows if the form has editable content. If set, all (not only the editable) rows of the form will get the line height of editable fields. The labels inside the form will be rendered by default in the according mode. Note: The setting of this property will be passed to all SmartField controls inside the form, so they will be editable if the form is editable. Warning: The setting of this property will not be passed to controls other than SmartField. For example, Input controls in a form with editable set to false are still editable. If controls other than SmartField controls are used, and the edit mode of their control is not set correctly, this might lead to visual issues. The labels and fields might be misaligned, the labels might be rendered in the wrong mode, and the spacing between the single controls might be wrong. Also, controls that do not fit the mode might be rendered incorrectly.
editable.helpDescription: Applies a device-specific and theme-specific line height and label alignment to the form rows if the form has editable content. If set, all (not only the editable) rows of the form will get the line height of editable fields. The labels inside the form will be rendered by default in the according mode. Note: The setting of this property will be passed to all SmartField controls inside the form, so they will be editable if the form is editable. Warning: The setting of this property will not be passed to controls other than SmartField. For example, Input controls in a form with editable set to false are still editable. If controls other than SmartField controls are used, and the edit mode of their control is not set correctly, this might lead to visual issues. The labels and fields might be misaligned, the labels might be rendered in the wrong mode, and the spacing between the single controls might be wrong. Also, controls that do not fit the mode might be rendered incorrectly.

importance.description: Specifies which smart fields will be visible inside the SmartForm. If set to high, only smart fields with high importance will be visible. If set to medium, only smart fields with high and medium importance will be visible. If set to low (default), all the smart fields will be visible regardless of their importance. Note: If a smart field is annotated as mandatory or hidden, its visibility will not be affected by the importance property.
importance.helpDescription: Specifies which smart fields will be visible inside the SmartForm. If set to high, only smart fields with high importance will be visible. If set to medium, only smart fields with high and medium importance will be visible. If set to low (default), all the smart fields will be visible regardless of their importance. Note: If a smart field is annotated as mandatory or hidden, its visibility will not be affected by the importance property.

checkButton.description: Specifies whether a check button is added to the toolbar.
checkButton.helpDescription: Specifies whether a check button is added to the toolbar.

editTogglable.description: If set to true, a button to toggle the editable property is shown in the toolbar.
editTogglable.helpDescription: If set to true, a button to toggle the editable property is shown in the toolbar.

flexEnabled.description:
Specifies whether the form enables flexibility features, such as adding new fields.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.
flexEnabled.helpDescription:
Specifies whether the form enables flexibility features, such as adding new fields.

title.description: Title of the form. Note: The title is rendered with a theme-dependent default level. As the SmartForm control cannot know the structure of the page, this might not fit the page structure. In this case provide the title using a {@link sap.m.Title Title} control and set its {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel level} to the required value. Add this title to a {@link sap.m.Toolbar Toolbar} control and assign it to the SmartForm using the customToolbar aggregation.
title.helpDescription: Title of the form. Note: The title is rendered with a theme-dependent default level. As the SmartForm control cannot know the structure of the page, this might not fit the page structure. In this case provide the title using a {@link sap.m.Title Title} control and set its {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel level} to the required value. Add this title to a {@link sap.m.Toolbar Toolbar} control and assign it to the SmartForm using the customToolbar aggregation.

validationMode.description: Controls the SmartForm validation mode. The default mode handles only nested SmartField controls with synchronous validation. If the SmartForm should also handle controls with asynchronous validation the property should be set to Async mode which is the recommended mode to be used as all types of nested fields validation are handled. Note: Using Async mode the method check will return a promise instead of an array. Note: Using Async mode the event checked will be called asynchronously when all the nested SmartField validations are executed.
validationMode.helpDescription: Controls the SmartForm validation mode. The default mode handles only nested SmartField controls with synchronous validation. If the SmartForm should also handle controls with asynchronous validation the property should be set to Async mode which is the recommended mode to be used as all types of nested fields validation are handled. Note: Using Async mode the method check will return a promise instead of an array. Note: Using Async mode the event checked will be called asynchronously when all the nested SmartField validations are executed.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

expanded.description: If expandable, this property indicates whether the state is expanded or not. If expanded, then the toolbar (if available) and the content is rendered; if expanded is false, then only the headerText/headerToolbar is rendered.
expanded.helpDescription: If expandable, this property indicates whether the state is expanded or not. If expanded, then the toolbar (if available) and the content is rendered; if expanded is false, then only the headerText/headerToolbar is rendered.

ignoredFields.description:
A list of fields that must not be available in the key-user adaptation dialog. Listed field names are separated by commas. The property is designed to be used by SAP Fiori elements, and it’s not evaluated by the SmartForm control itself. Note:
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

useHorizontalLayout.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.86 replaced by {@link sap.ui.comp.smartform.ColumnLayout ColumnLayout} in the layout aggregation.
Specifies whether the groups are rendered in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.ResponsiveLayout ResponsiveLayout} with the label above the field. Each group is rendered in a new line. Note: This property should no longer be used. To arrange the fields in columns, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartform.ColumnLayout ColumnLayout} should be used in the layout aggregation. Note: The value of this property will be passed on to the useHorizontalLayout property of all Group and GroupElement elements.

sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem.description: Represents a filter belonging to the basic group.
sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterBar/FilterItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getMandatory mandatory} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLabelTooltip labelTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getControlTooltip controlTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getPartOfCurrentVariant partOfCurrentVariant} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVisibleInFilterBar visibleInFilterBar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHiddenFilter hiddenFilter} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEntitySetName entitySetName} : string
    • {@link #getEntityTypeName entityTypeName} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getControl control} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem.helpDescription: Represents a filter belonging to the basic group.

Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMic.description:
The SmartAreaMicroChart control creates a AreaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which Micro Area Chart UI will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialised.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMic.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChartBase#constructor sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChartBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMic.helpDescription:
The SmartAreaMicroChart control creates a AreaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which Micro Area Chart UI will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialised.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

chartBindingPath.description:

If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead.

Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.description: ControlConfiguration can be used to add additional configuration for filter fields in the SmartFilterBar control, in order to overwrite the default settings from the OData metadata. For instance, it is possible to change the label, index or control type of a filter field.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/ControlConfiguration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getGroupId groupId} : string
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHasValueHelpDialog hasValueHelpDialog} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHasValidation hasValidation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getControlType controlType} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlType (default: 'auto')
    • {@link #getFilterType filterType} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.FilterType (default: 'auto')
    • {@link #getIndex index} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getHasTypeAhead hasTypeAhead} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMandatory mandatory} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.MandatoryType (default: 'auto')
    • {@link #getWidth width} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleInAdvancedArea visibleInAdvancedArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPreventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDisplayBehaviour displayBehaviour} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour (default: 'auto')
    • {@link #getHistoryEnabled historyEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getConditionPanelDefaultOperation conditionPanelDefaultOperation} : sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation
    • {@link #getTimezone timezone} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDefaultFilterValues defaultFilterValues} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOption[]
    • {@link #getCustomControl customControl} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.config.ControlConfigurationBase#constructor sap.ui.comp.config.ControlConfigurationBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.helpDescription: ControlConfiguration can be used to add additional configuration for filter fields in the SmartFilterBar control, in order to overwrite the default settings from the OData metadata. For instance, it is possible to change the label, index or control type of a filter field.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

defaultFilterValues.description: Default value for a filter field. The aggregation expects {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOption|SelectOption} instances, where the values' format (properties low and high) match the type of the referneced property and consider also the given constraints of the property. Samples for valid formats: Edm.DateTime with constraint sap:display-format='Date': "2018-12-24" (you optionally can provide a time-part and timezone, too, (2018-12-24T00:00:00Z) but this is ignored) Edm.DateTimeOffset: "2018-12-24T13:55:59Z" Edm.Time: "PT12H34M56S" Edm.Boolean: "false" Edm.Decimal: "2983.12"

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartDeltaMi.description:
The SmartDeltaMicroChart control creates a {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.DeltaMicroChart DeltaMicroChart} based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The delta micro chart represents the delta of two values as a chart.
The entitySet property is required to use the control. The entity set you specify in this property is used to fetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual data.
Notes:
  • Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
  • SmartDeltaMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartDeltaMicroChart cannot be created with a SmartMicroChart.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartDeltaMi.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartDeltaMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChartBase#constructor sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChartBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartDeltaMi.helpDescription:
The SmartDeltaMicroChart control creates a {@link sap.suite.ui.microchart.DeltaMicroChart DeltaMicroChart} based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The delta micro chart represents the delta of two values as a chart.
The entitySet property is required to use the control. The entity set you specify in this property is used to fetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual data.
Notes:
  • Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
  • SmartDeltaMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartDeltaMicroChart cannot be created with a SmartMicroChart.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

chartBindingPath.description:
This property can be used to specify a relative path (without '/') to an entity set (not a single entity) that is used during the binding of the chart.
For example, it can be a navigation property that will be added to the context path.
If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead.

sap.ui.comp.p13n.P13nItem.description: Base type for items aggregation in P13nPanel control.
sap.ui.comp.p13n.P13nItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new P13nItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getColumnKey columnKey} : string
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean
    • {@link #getType type} : string (default: "text")
    • {@link #getTypeInstance typeInstance} : object
    • {@link #getPrecision precision} : string
    • {@link #getFormatSettings formatSettings} : object
    • {@link #getScale scale} : string
    • {@link #getMaxLength maxLength} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : string
    • {@link #getIsDefault isDefault} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getValues values} : string[]
    • {@link #getRole role} : string
    • {@link #getAggregationRole aggregationRole} : string
    • {@link #getHref href} : string
    • {@link #getTarget target} : string
    • {@link #getPress press} : object
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
    • {@link #getNullable nullable} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.p13n.P13nItem.helpDescription: Base type for items aggregation in P13nPanel control.

}

sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field.description:
The SmartMultiEdit.Field control enables you to edit multiple homogeneous objects simultaneously. It allows you to select a predefined item from a combo box and apply your selection to all objects being edited.
In addition, SmartMultiEdit.Field can handle metadata for a specific OData property when you need to enable mass editing for multiple contexts. The contexts are handled by the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Container} control.
sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPropertyName propertyName} : string
    • {@link #getUseApplyToEmptyOnly useApplyToEmptyOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getApplyToEmptyOnly applyToEmptyOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
    • {@link #getValidateTokenExistence validateTokenExistence} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getConfiguration configuration} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.Configuration
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field.helpDescription:
The SmartMultiEdit.Field control enables you to edit multiple homogeneous objects simultaneously. It allows you to select a predefined item from a combo box and apply your selection to all objects being edited.
In addition, SmartMultiEdit.Field can handle metadata for a specific OData property when you need to enable mass editing for multiple contexts. The contexts are handled by the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Container} control.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

applyToEmptyOnly.description:
Indicates whether to check for an existing value in the data model before applying the changes.
Please note that this property does not automatically update the model. It is up to you as the app developer to decide whether you want to consider this property when updating the model or not.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.ui.comp.smartform.GroupElement.description: A GroupElement is a combination of one label and different controls associated to this label.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.GroupElement.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartform/GroupElement. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getUseHorizontalLayout useHorizontalLayout} : boolean
    • {@link #getHorizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth} : int
    • {@link #getElementForLabel elementForLabel} : int (default: 0)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getElements elements} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:visibleChanged visibleChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.layout.form.FormElement#constructor sap.ui.layout.form.FormElement} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.GroupElement.helpDescription: A GroupElement is a combination of one label and different controls associated to this label.

label.description: Label of the fields. Can either be a Label control or a string. If a Label control is used, the properties of the Label can be set. If no assignment between Label and the fields is set via (labelFor property of the Label), it will be done automatically by the FormElement. In this case the Label is assigned to the fields of the FormElement.

Deprecated! Since 1.48.0 please do not use this property as it does not have any effect on the current layout of the SmartForm control.
Specifies the minimal size in pixels of all group elements of the form if horizontal Layout is used. Note: If Group is assigned to a SmartForm control, this property is inherited from the SmartForm control. So don't set it manually.

useHorizontalLayout.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.86 replaced by {@link sap.ui.comp.smartform.ColumnLayout ColumnLayout} in the layout aggregation of the SmartForm control.
Specifies whether the groups shall be rendered in a ResponsiveLayout with label on top of the group element. Each group will be rendered in a new line. Note: If Group is assigned to a SmartForm control, this property is inherited from the SmartForm control. So don't set it to a different value from the one in the SmartForm control. For performance reasons it might make sense to set it manually to the same value as the one in the SmartForm control when creating the GroupElement element.

sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink.description:
The SmartLink control uses a semantic object to display {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover} for further navigation steps.
Note: Navigation targets are determined using {@link sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation CrossApplicationNavigation} of the unified shell service. Important: Keep in mind that SmartLink, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application. With time, SmartLink can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartLink only if you have control over the metadata of your application.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink.constructorDescription:
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSemanticObject semanticObject} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalSemanticObjects additionalSemanticObjects} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : any
    • {@link #getFieldName fieldName} : string
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectLabel semanticObjectLabel} : string
    • {@link #getCreateControlCallback createControlCallback} : function
    • {@link #getMapFieldToSemanticObject mapFieldToSemanticObject} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getContactAnnotationPath contactAnnotationPath} : string (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getIgnoreLinkRendering ignoreLinkRendering} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization enableAvailableActionsPersonalization} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getForceLinkRendering forceLinkRendering} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getUom uom} : string (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getBeforeNavigationCallback beforeNavigationCallback} : function
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWrapping wrapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback navigationTargetsObtainedCallback} : function
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getInnerControl innerControl} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:beforePopoverOpens beforePopoverOpens} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigationTargetsObtained navigationTargetsObtained} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:innerNavigate innerNavigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Link#constructor sap.m.Link} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink.helpDescription:
The SmartLink control uses a semantic object to display {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover} for further navigation steps.
Note: Navigation targets are determined using {@link sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation CrossApplicationNavigation} of the unified shell service. Important: Keep in mind that SmartLink, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application. With time, SmartLink can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartLink only if you have control over the metadata of your application.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

innerControl.description: Control that is displayed instead of SmartLink control, if the SmartLink is disabled (for example, if no navigation targets are available). If innerControl is not provided, the SmartLink control tries to create one with property createControlCallback.
innerControl.helpDescription: Control that is displayed instead of SmartLink control, if the SmartLink is disabled (for example, if no navigation targets are available). If innerControl is not provided, the SmartLink control tries to create one with property createControlCallback.

_icon.description: The icon control to be displayed as graphical element in the beginning of the Link.
_icon.helpDescription: The icon control to be displayed as graphical element in the beginning of the Link.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

_endIcon.description: The icon control to be displayed as graphical element at the end of the Link.
_endIcon.helpDescription: The icon control to be displayed as graphical element at the end of the Link.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

reactiveAreaMode.description:
Defines the size of the reactive area of the link:
  • ReactiveAreaMode.Inline - The link is displayed as part of a sentence.
  • ReactiveAreaMode.Overlay - The link is displayed as an overlay on top of other interactive parts of the page.
Note:It is designed to make links easier to activate and helps meet the WCAG 2.2 Target Size requirement. It is applicable only for the SAP Horizon themes. Note:The Reactive area size is sufficiently large to help users avoid accidentally selecting (clicking or tapping) on unintented UI elements. UI elements positioned over other parts of the page may need an invisible active touch area. This will ensure that no elements beneath are activated accidentally when the user tries to interact with the overlay element.

Note:It is designed to make links easier to activate and helps meet the WCAG 2.2 Target Size requirement. It is applicable only for the SAP Horizon themes. UI elements positioned over other parts of the page may need an invisible active touch area. This will ensure that no elements beneath are activated accidentally when the user tries to interact with the overlay element.

enableAvailableActionsPersonalization.description: Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control.
enableAvailableActionsPersonalization.helpDescription: Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control.

highlightAccKeysRef.description: Indicates whether the access keys ref of the control should be highlighted. NOTE: this property is used only when access keys feature is turned on.
highlightAccKeysRef.helpDescription: Indicates whether the access keys ref of the control should be highlighted. NOTE: this property is used only when access keys feature is turned on.

additionalSemanticObjects.description: Semantic object names which can be used additional to the default semanticObject property in order to get navigation targets links.
additionalSemanticObjects.helpDescription: Semantic object names which can be used additional to the default semanticObject property in order to get navigation targets links.

fieldName.description: The metadata field name for this SmartLink control.
fieldName.helpDescription: The metadata field name for this SmartLink control.

ariaHasPopup.description: Specifies the value of the aria-haspopup attribute If the value is None, the attribute will not be rendered. Otherwise it will be rendered according to the selected value. NOTE: Use this property only when a link is related to a popover/popup. The value needs to be equal to the main/root role of the popup - e.g. dialog, menu or list (examples: if you have dialog -> dialog, if you have menu -> menu; if you have list -> list; if you have dialog containing a list -> dialog). Do not use it, if you open a standard sap.m.Dialog, MessageBox or other type of dialogs displayed as on overlay over the application.
ariaHasPopup.helpDescription: Specifies the value of the aria-haspopup attribute If the value is None, the attribute will not be rendered. Otherwise it will be rendered according to the selected value. NOTE: Use this property only when a link is related to a popover/popup. The value needs to be equal to the main/root role of the popup - e.g. dialog, menu or list (examples: if you have dialog -> dialog, if you have menu -> menu; if you have list -> list; if you have dialog containing a list -> dialog). Do not use it, if you open a standard sap.m.Dialog, MessageBox or other type of dialogs displayed as on overlay over the application.

beforeNavigationCallback.description:
Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:
  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent
beforeNavigationCallback.helpDescription:
Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:
  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

validateUrl.description: Defines whether the link target URI should be validated. If validation fails, the value of the href property will still be set, but will not be applied to the DOM. Note: Additional URLs are allowed through {@link module:sap/base/security/URLListValidator URLListValidator}.
validateUrl.helpDescription: Defines whether the link target URI should be validated. If validation fails, the value of the href property will still be set, but will not be applied to the DOM. Note: Additional URLs are allowed through {@link module:sap/base/security/URLListValidator URLListValidator}.

navigationTargetsObtainedCallback.description: Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.
navigationTargetsObtainedCallback.helpDescription: Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets}. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

icon.description: Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element in the beginning of the Link. It can be an icon from the icon font. Note: Usage of icon-only link is not supported, the link must always have a text. Note: We recommend using n icon in the beginning or the end only, and always with text. Note: Using an image instead of icon is not supported.
icon.helpDescription: Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element in the beginning of the Link. It can be an icon from the icon font. Note: Usage of icon-only link is not supported, the link must always have a text. Note: We recommend using n icon in the beginning or the end only, and always with text. Note: Using an image instead of icon is not supported.

enabled.description: Determines whether the link can be triggered by the user.
enabled.helpDescription: Determines whether the link can be triggered by the user.

emptyIndicatorMode.description: Specifies if an empty indicator should be displayed when there is no text.
emptyIndicatorMode.helpDescription: Specifies if an empty indicator should be displayed when there is no text.

contactAnnotationPath.description: Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.
contactAnnotationPath.helpDescription: Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

textDirection.description: This property specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the parent DOM.
textDirection.helpDescription: This property specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the parent DOM.

accessibleRole.description:
Describes the accessibility role of the link:
  • LinkAccessibleRole.Default - a navigation is expected to the location given in href property
  • LinkAccessibleRole.Button - there will be role attribute with value "Button" rendered. In this scenario the href property value shouldn't be set as navigation isn't expected to occur.
accessibleRole.helpDescription:
Describes the accessibility role of the link:
  • LinkAccessibleRole.Default - a navigation is expected to the location given in href property
  • LinkAccessibleRole.Button - there will be role attribute with value "Button" rendered. In this scenario the href property value shouldn't be set as navigation isn't expected to occur.

accesskey.description: Indicates which keyboard key should be pressed to focus the access key ref NOTE: this property is used only when access keys feature is turned on.
accesskey.helpDescription: Indicates which keyboard key should be pressed to focus the access key ref NOTE: this property is used only when access keys feature is turned on.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

emphasized.description: Emphasized links look visually more important than regular links.
emphasized.helpDescription: Emphasized links look visually more important than regular links.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

mapFieldToSemanticObject.description: If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several SmartLink controls on the same semantic object.
mapFieldToSemanticObject.helpDescription: If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several SmartLink controls on the same semantic object.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

rel.description: Specifies the value of the HTML rel attribute. Note: A default value of noopener noreferrer is set only to links that have a cross-origin URL and a specified target with value other than _self.
rel.helpDescription: Specifies the value of the HTML rel attribute. Note: A default value of noopener noreferrer is set only to links that have a cross-origin URL and a specified target with value other than _self.

ignoreLinkRendering.description: If set to true, the SmartLink control will render the innerControl or the control provided by createControlCallback instead of the actual link. This is used for example by the SemanticObjectController if this SmartLink is listed in its ignoredFields or no navigation targets were found during prefetch.
ignoreLinkRendering.helpDescription: If set to true, the SmartLink control will render the innerControl or the control provided by createControlCallback instead of the actual link. This is used for example by the SemanticObjectController if this SmartLink is listed in its ignoredFields or no navigation targets were found during prefetch.

endIcon.description: Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element in the end of the Link. It can be an icon from the icon font. Note: Usage of icon-only link is not supported, the link must always have a text. Note: We recommend using n icon in the beginning or the end only, and always with text. Note: Using an image instead of icon is not supported.
